json_to_edit.voice_over: Little did I know, this game was about to become my reality.
json_to_edit.description: Alex gets trapped in a virtual world while playing a new immersive game.
json_to_edit.location: Alex's bedroom transitioning to a virtual fantasy world
json_to_edit.lighting: Soft bedroom light to vibrant, surreal lighting
json_to_edit.ambience_sound_keywords: Computer hum, digital beeps, fantasy music
json_to_edit.name: Virtual Entrapment
json_to_edit.scene_summary: Alex, an unsuspecting gamer, gets pulled into a virtual world while testing a new game.

qa.action: Alex's cluttered bedroom with multiple screens showing the game loading.

hf.action: Alex's excited face illuminated by screen glow as he starts the game.

tr.action: Alex putting on VR headset, his surroundings starting to shimmer and distort.

xc.action: Alex's bedroom transforming into a lush, colorful virtual forest.

ka.action: Alex's eyes widening in awe as he looks around the virtual world.

fn.sfx_keywords: footsteps on virtual grass, ambient magic sounds
fn.action: Alex cautiously taking his first steps in the virtual forest.

af.action: Dark clouds forming on the horizon of the virtual world, hinting at danger.

qo.action: Alex's face showing growing concern as he realizes he can't log out.

fp.action: Alex frantically swiping at the air, trying to access non-existent game menus.

va.action: The virtual forest darkening as Alex stands alone, trapped in the game world.

edit_command: Change the weather to stormy and increase the number of shots to 12

updated_json.voice_over: Little did I know, this game was about to become my reality.

updated_json.location: Alex's bedroom transitioning to a virtual fantasy world

bx.action: The virtual forest being battered by a sudden, intense storm, trees swaying violently.

yz.action: Alex's terrified expression as lightning illuminates his face, realizing the storm is all too real in this virtual world.

label.rationale: we need to update the json according to the edit command, which requires changing the weather to stormy and increasing the number of shots from 10 to 12. this will involve modifying the "weather" field and the "number_of_shots" field. additionally, we need to add two new shots to the "shots" section to reflect the increased number of shots. we'll update the "list_display_order" in the "shots" section and add two new shot entries. the new shots will be designed to emphasize the stormy weather and its impact on alex's situation.
